title: Tyrian Forum
content:
Yesterday I discovered there is an ezBoard community that's even smaller than ours, devoted to Tyrian.

[url=http://p078.ezboard.com/btyrian]p078.ezboard.com/btyrian[/url]

There's a lot of potential there, and there are some interesting projects being worked on, including an official sequel (sounds like it could end up mainstream-3D, but we shall see). The tools available for Tyrian modding are fairly limited at the moment, but I've got a few things in mind that may change that situation.

There's also a nice compendium website, for more Tyrian news and info. If you've not heard of Tyrian, go there now and download Tyrian 2000, which has been Freeware for some time it seems.
[url=http://members.iinet.net.au/~vannevar/tyrian/]members.iinet.net.au/~vannevar/tyrian/[/url]

title: Re: Tyrian Forum
content:
Well well well, it appears Big brother Spleen is giving the Tyrian forumers a hand.

Now perhaps people will stop moaning at the size of our community.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Tyrian Forum
content:
I found that a long time ago. Tyrian is an awesome awesome game and has a cult like following but... It just doesn't have nor ever had any community.

If you look at the forum there are only a few new topics... the rest are years old. An unfortunate fate to a great game. (I thought that is what happened to the Commander Keen community for years.) I think that most of it is due to the fact that it only takes an afternoon to play thought the entire game AND that there were no sequels.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://img360.imageshack.us/img360/548/blegdandsmeegnewbanner2wf.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Tyrian Forum
content: If you poke through the topics here three years back when it was first created, you'd see my little personal announcement about it. It's a slow forum, true, but something interesting crops up every now and then.

title: Re: Tyrian Forum
content:
If you poke through the topics here three years back you will find: "(This post is missing and can not be restored)"

Besides EZ board doesn't keep topics more than 5 pages or so back.

content: The first post of topics were kept even after the crash, I think. And it used to retain up to 20 pages of topics. Apparently that's changed since the last time I checked, though.
